page.title: 10Natural history (ecology)
page.content:
The block is split into 3 areas _ lowland, woodland and the upper land.
The upper and lower lands are both very flat with very heavy clay soil, the village is well named _ Draycott in the{Clay.}
The woodland is very old and is now almost equally deciduous/coniferous, although most of the coniferous areas have been planted fairly recently. Some of the mature hardwoods e.g.{oak {and ash}were planted 150 years ago.
Over the last few years{Dutch Elm {Disease}has wiped out 2-3000 elms, but it is hoped that the remaining 30 or so elms will now be immune from it.
The forest timber is used mainly for furniture, pallets and fencing.
